result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J. CALLAHAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court orders that restitution be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  The balance remaining at release from prison to be paid as a condition of extended supervision at a rate to be determined by the agent.

superMiscConds.notes:
To the victim.  
(the parties have 60 days to submit a stipulation regarding additional restitution for lost wages.  It not stipulated to, a hearing will be set)

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Defendant must registrer as a sexual offender and comply with all terms of the Sex Offender Registry.

Defendant is not to possess or use any device capable of connecting to the internet unless approved by the agent.

Have no contact with M.E.G. or her family.

Have no contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless approved by the agent.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

records.addlTxt:
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 1, 2nd degree sexual assault of child. Convicted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 5, possess child pornography. Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2, 3 and 4.  Motion granted.
The Court orders a Presentence Investigation Report be completed by DOC. 
The Court also orders a Psychosexual evaluation be completed.
(the court instructs the Clerk to indicate on the order for presentence that there has already been a PSI ordered in a similarly charged case in Kewaunee County, 15 CF 38, and that both Manitowoc and Kewaunee County charges are to be included in this PSI)
Presentence Report is due by 09-09-16.
Sentencing is set for 09-16-16 at 1:30 p.m.
Court orders defendant to submit to a DNA sample.
Minutes.
Plea date on June 30, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Petition and Order to Withdraw as Counsel of Record.
It is hereby ordered, that Adam Snavely be, and hereby is allowed to withdraw as counsel of record for the defendant aboved-named. A new attorney will be appointed by the office of the State Public Defender.
Settlement conference with District Attorney reset to 10-14-2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.   Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 09-23-15 at 9:30 a.m.    State's Motion and Demand for Discovery. 
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 08-05-15 at 2:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $2,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with M.E.G.   Bail furnished.  
Minutes.
Adam Snavely, through Public Defender.

RE:  M.E.G., DOB: 04-18-2000, on 04-26-15.
Initial appearance is set for 07-27-15 at 2:30 p.m.
